MetaData.MetaDataItem: To remove or exclude the danalock into a Z-Wave network Set the controller in exclusion mode Touch the User Button until you hear two beeps.
To add or include the danalock into a Z-Wave network Set the controller in inclusion mode Touch the User Button until you hear two beeps.
The danalock can be set to factory settings by holding the User Button for ten beeps. Please use this procedure only when the primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.

Z-Wave Controlled door lock with keypad, and Bluetooth Smart. Operated by Z-Wave. Connect Danalock to your Z-Wave gateway - Danalock interfaces with your existing Z-Wave network through the Danalock smartphone app. Operate Danalock remotely by accessing your Z-Wave network from anywhere in the world with internet access.

Value.label: Direction
Value.Help: 0=The motor goes clockwise when unlatched; 1= The motor goes counterclockwise when unlatched

Value.label: Lock Mode
Value.Help: 0=Stepper motor mode wave drive (Power Saving); 1=Stepper motor mode full drive(Normal)

Value.label: Lock Turn Degrees
Value.Help: Factor 10 turn degree( 1 = degrees, 9 = 90 degres, etc. )

Value.label: Auto Latch time
Value.Help: How many seconds from the lock has been unlatched to it automatically close again. If 0 then it's disabled

Value.label: Sound
Value.Help: Disable or enable the beep sound from latch or unlatch operations(

Value.label: Battery Type
Value.Help: Set the type of battery that powers the device. This affect the returned battery state.

Value.label: Battery Alarm Percent
Value.Help: When the battery level is equal to, or under this value, the device will notify with a beep sound after latch or unlatch

Value.label: Turn and Go
Value.Help: Used if the lock is using a optional rotation sensor. Latch and Go on will turn automatically when manual turn is detected.

Value.label: Brake and Go Back
Value.Help: 0 = Disabled. 1-15 Seconds to brake. When used the lock will brake for x amount of seconds and then turn 75 degrees back. Made for special doors without door lever.(Only when unlatching).

Value.label: Async
Value.Help: Used if the lock is using an optional rotation sensor. When async is enabled the lock will auto calibrate if already unlatched and asked to Unlatch again (used for special door locks where the key turn is asynced from the inside nob.)

Value.label: Door lock operation report type
Value.Help: 0 = Simple supported by all controllers that support door locks. 1 = Advanced, more specific reports through notification Command Class. 2 = No Door lock operation reports are sent unsolicited.
